ColumnB: Use of handheld fan directed at face Oxygen supplementation Oral, intravenous or subcutaneous opioids (starting at 25% of dose recommended for pain management) Integrative and supportive therapies

Over-the-counter cough medicines (e.g. honey preparations) Nebulized saline (for children with thick secretions or insufficient cough strength) Chest physiotherapy Opioids if needed (starting at 25% of dose recommended for pain management)
Antifibrinolytics as prevention or to stop haemoptysis
